action.action-desc: Mr. MacArthur (for himself, Mr. Collins of New York, Mr. Schweikert, Ms. Kuster of New Hampshire, Mr. Blumenauer, and Mr. Tonko) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to authorize the suspension of payments by Medicare prescription drug plans and MA–PD plans pending investigations of credible allegations of fraud by pharmacies.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Excessive Narcotics in our Retirement Communities Protection Act or the SENIOR Communities Protection Act.

section.header: Suspension of payments by Medicare prescription drug plans and MA–PD plans pending investigations of credible allegations of fraud by pharmacies

subsection.text: Section 1860D–12(b) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–112(b)) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Suspension of payments pending investigation of credible allegations of fraud by pharmacies

subparagraph.text: The provisions of section 1862(o) shall apply with respect to a PDP sponsor with a contract under this part, a pharmacy, and payments to such pharmacy under this part in the same manner as such provisions apply with respect to the Secretary, a provider of services or supplier, and payments to such provider of services or supplier under this title.
Nothing in this paragraph shall be construed as limiting the authority of a PDP sponsor to conduct postpayment review.

subsection.text: Section 1857(f)(3) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–27(f)(3)) is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Suspension of payments pending investigation of credible allegations of fraud by pharmacies

subsection.text: Section 1862(o)(3) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395y(o)(3)) is amended by inserting , section 1860D–12(b)(7) (including as applied pursuant to section 1857(f)(3)(D)), after this subsection.

subsection.header: Clarification relating to credible allegation of fraud
subsection.text: Section 1862(o) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395y(o)) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: In carrying out this subsection, section 1860D–12(b)(7) (including as applied pursuant to section 1857(f)(3)(D)), and section 1903(i)(2)(C), a fraud hotline tip (as defined by the Secretary) without further evidence shall not be treated as sufficient evidence for a credible allegation of fraud.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to plan years beginning on or after January 1, 2020.
